00010 #ifndef LITM_H_
00011 #define LITM_H_

00013 #       include <sys/types.h>

00017 #       define LITM_CONNECTION_MAX 15
00018 #       define LITM_BUSSES_MAX     7

00020                 /**
00021                  * Queue node - entry in a queue
00022                  *
00023                  * @param msg:  pointer to the message
00024                  * @param next: pointer to the ``next`` queue_node entry
00025                  */
00026                 typedef struct _queue_node {
00027                         void *msg;
00028                         struct _queue_node *next;
00029                 } queue_node;
00030 
00031                 /**
00032                  * Queue - thread-safe
00033                  *
00034                  * @param mutex: mutex
00035                  * @param head:  pointer to ``head``
00036                  * @param tail:  pointer to ``tail``
00037                  */
00038                 typedef struct {
00039                         pthread_mutex_t *mutex;
00040                         queue_node *head, *tail;
00041                 } queue;
00042 
00043 
00044                 /**
00045                  * ``Bus`` identifier type
00046                  */
00047                 typedef int litm_bus;
00048 
00049                 /**
00050                  * ``Connection`` type
00051                  *
00052                  * @param input_queue the connection's input queue
00053                  */
00054                 typedef struct _litm_connection {
00055                         queue *input_queue;
00056                 } litm_connection;
00057 
00058                 //typedef _litm_connection litm_connection;
00059 
00060                 /**
00061                  * Envelope Routing
00062                  *
00063                  * @param pending Pending Status Flag
00064                  * @param bus_id  Destination ``bus``
00065                  * @param sender  The sender's connection pointer
00066                  * @param current The current recipient's connection pointer
00067                  */
00068                 typedef struct {
00069                         int                              pending;
00070                         litm_bus         bus_id;
00071                         litm_connection *sender;
00072                         litm_connection *current;
00073                 } __litm_routing;
00074 
00075 
00076 
00077 
00078                 // Return Codes
00079                 // ------------
00080                 //
00081                 typedef enum _litm_codes {
00082                         LITM_CODE_OK = 0,
00083                         LITM_CODE_NO_MESSAGE,
00084                         LITM_CODE_BUSY,
00085                         LITM_CODE_ERROR_MALLOC,
00086                         LITM_CODE_ERROR_CONNECTION_OPEN,
00087                         LITM_CODE_ERROR_BAD_CONNECTION,
00088                         LITM_CODE_ERROR_NO_MORE_CONNECTIONS,
00089                         LITM_CODE_ERROR_INVALID_BUS,
00090                         LITM_CODE_ERROR_SWITCH_SENDER_EQUAL_CURRENT,
00091                         LITM_CODE_ERROR_SWITCH_NO_CURRENT,
00092                         LITM_CODE_ERROR_SWITCH_NEXT_NOT_FOUND,
00093                         LITM_CODE_ERROR_OUTPUT_QUEUING,                                 //can't send to the recipient
00094                         LITM_CODE_BUSY_OUTPUT_QUEUE,
00095                         LITM_CODE_ERROR_INVALID_ENVELOPE,
00096 
00097                 } litm_code;
00098 
00099 
00100                 /**
00101                  * ``Envelope`` structure for messages
00102                  *
00103                  * @param cleaner The ``cleaner`` function to use
00104                  * @param routes  The ``routing`` structure
00105                  * @param msg     The pointer to the message
00106                  *
00107                  * Contains the pointer to the message
00108                  *  as well as a ``routing`` structure
00109                  *  used to deliver the said message
00110                  *  to all bus which have at least
00111                  *  1 subscriber.
00112                  *
00113                  * The client (ie. receiver of the envelope)
00114                  *  must not tamper with the message (ie. msg)
00115                  *  as it is shared with other client(s).
00116                  *
00117                  */
00118                 typedef struct _litm_envelope {
00119 
00120                         // cleaning function callback
00121                         void (*cleaner)(void *msg);
00122 
00123                         // the routing information
00124                         __litm_routing routes;
00125 
00126                         // the sender's message
00127                         void *msg;
00128 
00129                 } litm_envelope;
00130 
00131 
00132 
00133         // API
00134         // ===
00135         //
00136                 /**
00137                  * Opens a ``connection`` to the ``switch``
00138                  *  and returns a pointer to the connection reference
00139                  *
00140                  * @param **conn pointer to connection reference
00141                  */
00142                 litm_code litm_connect(litm_connection **conn);
00143 
00144 
00145                 /**
00146                  * Disconnects from the ``switch``
00147                  *
00148                  * @param *conn connection reference
00149                  */
00150                 litm_code litm_disconnect(litm_connection *conn);
00151 
00152 
00153                 /**
00154                  * Subscribe to a ``bus``
00155                  *
00156                  * @param *conn connection reference
00157                  * @param bus_id the ``bus`` identifier to subscribe to
00158                  *
00159                  */
00160                 litm_code litm_subscribe(litm_connection *conn, litm_bus bus_id);
00161 
00162 
00163                 /**
00164                  * Unsubscribe from a ``bus``
00165                  *
00166                  * @param *conn connection reference
00167                  * @param bus_id the ``bus`` identifier to unsubscribe from
00168                  */
00169                 litm_code litm_unsubscribe(litm_connection *conn, litm_bus bus_id);
00170 
00171 
00172                 /**
00173                  * Send message on a ``bus``
00174                  *
00175                  * @param *conn connection reference
00176                  * @param bus_id the ``bus`` to send the message onto
00177                  * @param *msg the pointer to the message
00178                  * @param *cleaner the pointer to the cleaner function
00179                  *
00180                  * If omitted, the default ``cleaner`` function will be
00181                  * <b>free()</b>.
00182                  *
00183                  * If an error occurs, it is the responsibility of the sender
00184                  *  to dispose of the ``messages`` appropriately.  If the
00185                  *  operation went LITM_CODE_OK, then once all recipients
00186                  *  are finished with the message, the ``cleaner`` will be
00187                  *  called with the message pointer OR if ``cleaner`` is
00188                  *  NULL, the message will simply be freed with free().
00189                  *
00190                  */
00191                 litm_code litm_send(    litm_connection *conn,
00192                                                                 litm_bus bus_id,
00193                                                                 void *msg,
00194                                                                 void (*cleaner)(void *msg)
00195                                                                 );
00196 
00197 
00198                 /**
00199                  * Receives (non-blocking) from any ``bus``
00200                  */
00201                 litm_code litm_receive_nb(litm_connection *conn, litm_envelope **envlp);
00202 
00203 
00204                 /**
00205                  * Releases an ``envelope``
00206                  *
00207                  *  Once the client has consumed the message
00208                  *  ``contained`` in the envelope, the client
00209                  *  **MUST** release it back to litm.
00210                  */
00211                 litm_code litm_release(litm_connection *conn, litm_envelope *envlp);
00212 
00213 
00214                 /**
00215                  * Returns a copy of the pointer to the
00216                  *  message.
00217                  *
00218                  * This function should be used instead
00219                  *  of relying on the ``litm_envelope``
00220                  *  data structure.
00221                  *
00222                  *  ** DO NOT** modify the message!
00223                  */
00224                 void *litm_get_message(litm_envelope *envlp);
00225 
00226 
00227                 /**
00228                  * Translates a code to a message pointer
00229                  */
00230                 char *litm_translate_code(litm_code code);

00232 
00233 #endif /* LITM_H_ */
